text.p: The following are leading domestic stories in Portuguese newspapers.
- The problem of illicit drugs will not go away despite the toughening of jail sentences for offenders, according to a prepared speech by President Jorge Sampaio.
- The chief organiser of the Expo 1998 World Fair in Lisbon, Antonio Cardoso e Cunha, resigned complaining of political pressures.
- The cost of gas for domestic and industrial consumption will rise by five percent from February.
- Standard & Poor's gave Banco Espirito Santo the best rating among Portuguese banks.
- Prime Minister Antonio Guterres lamented the decision of Antonio Cardoso e Cunha to resign as chief organiser of the Expo 1998 World Fair in Lisbon.
